author: chirino
msg: check for release after processig io tasks

author: jlmonteiro
msg: OPENEJB-1241: Using @WebServiceRef doesn't allow Service.create usage (standard JAX-WS usage). OpenEJB register its own ProviderWrapper during the first call (ie. set the system property). So, for upcoming JAX-WS usage, our ProviderWrapper will be used.

author: jlmonteiro
msg: As defined by java.io.InputStream, mark/reset aren't always available. It may cause IOException in the reserialize method.
Remove some CXF interceptors because they don't make sense for EJB WebServices.

author: ruppert
msg: In an effort to clean up the definition of the In the News section, MyOFBiz has offered remove the link to their homepage and replace it with a link to a specific post in the not too distant future.  Thanks and please add your company entry to the Service Providers List here - http://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/x/jwBk - so we can list your company directly.  If you need help, let me know.
